name: 尤丽娅·索恩采娃 Yuliya Solntseva
intro:
Yuliya Ippolitovna Solntseva (Russian: Ю́лия Ипполи́товна Со́лнцева; 7 August 1901 – 28 October 1989) was a Soviet actress and film director. As an actress, she is known for starring in the silent sci-fi classic Aelita (1924). 　　Yuliya Ippolitovna Solntseva (Russian: Ю́лия Ипполи́товна Со́лнцева; 7 August 1901 – 28 October 1989) was a Soviet actress and film director. As an actress, she is known for starring in the silent sci-fi classic Aelita (1924). She is the first female winner of the Best Director Award at Cannes film festival in the 20th century and the first woman to win a directing prize at any of the major European film festivals, for the film Chronicle of Flaming Years, a war drama about Russian resistance to Nazi occupation in 1941.　　杜甫仁科之妻
hezuo: 伊戈尔·伊林斯基 Igor Ilyinsky
茂文·道格拉斯 Melvyn Douglas
丽塔·科尔泰塞 Rita Cortese
伊莱亚斯·科泰斯 Elias Koteas
